Text: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will abide in the shadow of the Almighty.
Context: The psalmist expresses a serene trust in God's protection, comparing it to a sheltering presence.

Text: I will say to the LORD, “My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.”
Context: A declaration of trust in God, using metaphors of a refuge and fortress to describe God's protective qualities.

Text: Surely He will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, and from the deadly pestilence.
Context: An assurance of God's deliverance from hidden dangers and diseases, likening dangers to a hunter's snare.

Text: He will cover you with His feathers; under His wings you will find refuge; His faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
Context: Symbolic imagery of God as a bird providing shelter with its feathers, emphasizing God's faithfulness as a form of protection.

Text: You will not fear the terror of the night, nor the arrow that flies by day,
Context: Conveying a sense of safety that nullifies fear of night terrors or daytime attacks.

Text: nor the pestilence that stalks in darkness, nor the destruction that lays waste at noon.
Context: Expanding upon the previous verse, highlighting protection against threats regardless of the time of day.

Text: A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.
Context: Emphasizing God's protective power in stark contrast to the fate of others, suggesting a divine selection of protection.

Text: You will only look on with your eyes and see the recompense of the wicked.
Context: Providing a sense of divine justice, where the observer remains untouched while witnessing the consequences befalling the wicked.

Text: Because you have made the LORD your dwelling—my refuge, the Most High—
Context: A reiteration of trust and the resolve to remain in God's presence, which provides safety and refuge.

Text: no evil will befall you, no plague will approach your tent.
Context: An unequivocal assurance that no harm will come to those who dwell in God’s presence.

Text: For He will command His angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways;
Context: An assurance of angelic protection on God's orders, providing a constant divine guard.

Text: they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
Context: This verse furthers the promise of protection, with a very personal and attentive care to avoid even minor harm.

Text: You will tread on the lion and cobra; you will trample the young lion and serpent.
Context: Symbolizing triumph over powerful and dangerous forces, suggesting a spiritual authority granted to the believer.

Text: “Because he loves Me,” says the LORD, “I will deliver him; I will set him securely on high, because he has known My name.”
Context: God's response to the believer's love and knowledge of God, promising deliverance and a place of safety.

Text: He will call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble. I will deliver him and honor him.
Context: God's promise to answer the believer's call, offering presence in times of trouble and deliverance.

Text: With long life I will satisfy him and show him My salvation.
Context: A concluding promise of a long life and the ultimate gift of salvation as a testament to God's favor and protection.
